title: JEHOVAH - UBϽŋ ESIE
author: Bedford
lyrics:
Chant 2A. Woodward			366				R. C. H. 718.
Nnyin Itoro Fi, O Abasi; Nnyin Imọfiọk Ite Afo Edi Ọbọñg
1.	Nnyin itoro fi, O Abasi; nnyin imọfiọk ite Afo edi Ọbọñg.
2.	Kpukpru ererimbot ekpono Fi, nsinsi ete.
3.	Kpukpru mme angel efiori ekot Fi; mme enyọñg ye Kpukpru mme odudu ke esit.
4.	Kpukpru mme cherubim ye mme seraphim itreke ndikwọrọ, ete;
5.	Edisana, edisana, edisana; Ọbọñg Abasi sabaoth;
6.	Uteñghe ubọñg fo ọyọhọ enyọñg ye isọñg.
7.	Ata eti mbon mme Apostle etoro Fi.
8.	Eti otu mme prophet etoro Fi.
9.	Mmͻ eke ewotde ke ntak mfo etoro Fi.
10.	Edisana ikọt Abasi ofuri ekondo onyime Fi;
11.	Ete ata akwa uteñghe;
12.	Ye nkukere Eyen Fo;
13.	Ye Edisana spirit Iberedem.
14.	Afo, O Christ, edi Edidem Ubọñg.
15.	Afo edi nsinsi Eyen Ete.
16.	Ke ini Afo akaduakde ndifak owo, Afo ukusinke idibi Eyen ñwan ke ndek.
17.	Ke Afo ama akan ndutuhọ mkpa ama, Afo okosio usuñg ubọñg Heaven ọnọ mmọ emi ebuọtde idem enọ Fi.
18.	Afo etie k’ubọk nnasia Abasi, ke ubọñg Ete.
19.	Nnyin imonim ite, Afo eyetọñghọ ntak edi, man ekpe ikpe ye nnyin.
20.	Do, nnyin ibeñghe Fi, nyañgha ifin Fo, emi Afo akafakde ye ọsọñg urua iyip Okuomọ.
21.	Yak ebat mmọ esin ke out edisana ikọt Fo, ke ubọñg emi edibigide ke nsinsi.
22.	O Ọbọñg nyañgha ikọt Fo, nyuñg diọñg nditọ Fo.
23.	Kara mmọ nyuñg nim mmọ ke enyọñg ke nsinsi.

title: Edi Yak Nnyin Ikwͻ
author: Franconia
lyrics:
All People That On Earth Do Dwell
Make a joyful noise unto the Lord. 	Psalm 100:1
All people that on earth do dwell,
Sing to the Lord with cheerful voice,
Him serve with mirth, His praise forth tell;
Come ye before Him and rejoice.
The Lord, ye know, is God in deed;
Without our aid He did us make;
We are His folk, He doth us feed;
And for His sheep He doth us take.
O enter then His gates with praise,
Approach with joy His courts unto.
Praise, laud, and bless His name always
For it is seemly so to do.
For why! The Lord our God is good
His mercy is for ever sure;
His truth at all times firmly stood,
And shall from age to age endure.
WILLIAM KETHE, d, 1593 (1).
